observations: Objects in the input grid are moved to different positions in the output grid.
The general structure of the object arrangements is mirrored diagonally.
Empty cells in the input grid remain empty in the output grid.
Non-zero numbers appear to swap positions.
Objects are reflected about both the horizontal and vertical center.
hypotheses: Objects in the input grid are reflected across the horizontal and vertical center to generate the output grid.
Non-zero objects' positions are transformed using a rotation, possibly combined with reflection.
selected_rule: Objects are reflected across the horizontal and vertical center to generate the output grid.
step_plan: For each non-zero object in the input grid, reflect its position across the horizontal center of the grid.
Then reflect the resulting position across the vertical center of the grid.
Place the object in the reflected position in the output grid.
